pageContext.title: African American History, Culture and Digital Humanities
pageContext.description_excerpt: African American History, Culture and Digital Humanities (AADHum) was awarded to the College of Arts and Humanities (ARHU) and is being co-directed by MITH and the Arts and Humanities Center for Synergy (Center for Synergy). The project was funded by a $1.25 million grant from the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation for research, education and training at the intersections of digital humanities and African American studies, and will help to prepare a diverse community of scholars and students whose work will both broaden the reach of the digital humanities in African American history and cultural studies, and enrich humanities research with new methods, archives and tools.
pageContext.project_directors: Trevor Muñoz, Bonnie Thornton Dill, Sheri Parks
pageContext.participants: Babak Hamidzadeh, Bonnie Thornton Dill, Bria Parker, Catherine Knight Steele, Curlee Holton, Dan Mack, Doug McElrath, Ed Summers, Jen Eidson, Kirsten Keister, Nathan Putnam, Purdom Lindblad, Raffaele Viglianti, Sheri Parks, Stephanie Maxwell, Stephanie Sapienza, Trevor Muñoz, Julie Greene
